definition: to shake/to flap/to vibrate/to resonate/to rise up with spirit/to rouse oneself

sentences.english: He cites the pork industry, which used to be blighted with hog cholera.
sentences.chinese: 他列舉了曾因豬霍亂而萎靡不振的養豬業。

sentences.english: We were wilting under the burning sun.
sentences.chinese: 我們在烈日下變得萎靡不振。

sentences.english: So, Cicero first warned us against the danger of being lackadaisical .
sentences.chinese: 西塞羅首先警告我們要注意萎靡不振的危險。

sentences.english: Monica is dysfunctional because of her breakup with Richard.
sentences.chinese: 莫妮卡因爲和裏查德分手而萎靡不振。

sentences.english: He was too lazy to exert himself and rusted out long before his time.
sentences.chinese: 他懶得萎靡不振，因此早就未老先衰了。

sentences.english: She was enervated by the luxury of palace life.
sentences.chinese: 宮廷的奢華生活使她變得萎靡不振。
長期借款依然萎靡不振。

sentences.english: Arise in oil prices depresses the car market.
sentences.chinese: 石油價格的擡高使汽車市場萎靡不振。

sentences.english: His spirits sagged after that strike.
sentences.chinese: 受到打擊後他有點萎靡不振了。
它已經有一些萎靡不振。

sentences.english: That will be hard to sustain, given America's fiscal woes.
sentences.chinese: 如此揮霍，美國萎靡不振的財政實難維持。

sentences.english: The world agrochemical industry is going into hard time.
sentences.chinese: 近年來，世界農藥工業萎靡不振，正在經歷艱難時刻。

definition: variant of 萎靡不振[wei3 mi3 bu4 zhen4]
dispirited and downcast (idiom); listless/in low spirits/washed out
looking or feeling sickly/weak and dispirited through illness
listless/dispirited/washed out/also written 沒精打彩|没精打彩
dull and colorless (idiom); lacking vitality/not lively
one stumble, unable to rise (idiom); a setback leading to total collapse/ruined at a stroke/unable to recover after a minor hitch
